title: Sloppy Session as All Eyes on Fed, Apple Earnings
text:
A slightly negative reaction to Alphabet (GOOGL) combined with a technically extended market and worries about the Federal Reserve's interest-rate decision on Wednesday, helped to produce sloppy action on Tuesday. Losses were minor and breadth was slightly positive, as traders jostled for position in front of Wednesday's news.

Not only is the Fed issuing its interest rate policy at 2 p.m. ET, but the big Kahuna, Apple (AAPL) reports after the bell. With the S&P 500 breaking to a new all-time high Monday, we can be certain that there will be some traders looking for a "sell the news" reaction.

There were some headlines about the U.S. House of Representatives voting on impeachment procedures that caused some slight movement, but this does not seem to be an issue that is causing much concern for equities.

Many stocks could use a rest after a good two-week run, so there is a greater tendency to put a negative spin on news. The big issue Wednesday will be whether the Fed hints the possibility of another rate cut before the end of the year. There is no shortage of pundits pointing out the irony of the fact that the S&P 500 is at all-time highs, while the Fed thinks the economy is weak enough to justify rate cuts.

The one certainty about the Fed decision is that it will generate some movement. As I've written often, the market loves to love the Fed, and usually looks for a positive spin. That will be the big issue for traders to grapple with.

There wasn't much movement Tuesday, but that is actually healthy in this context. The market needs a pause day, if it is going to continue to work higher.

Have a good evening. I'll see you Wednesday.

(Apple and Alphabet are holdings in Jim Cramer's Action Alerts PLUS member club. Want to be alerted before Jim Cramer buys or sells these stocks? Learn more now.)
description: While the markets mostly brushed off impeachment news, there was little movement Tuesday, as investors await more earnings and an interest-rate decision....GOOGL
authors: Sloppy Session As All Eyes On Fed
While The Markets Mostly Brushed Off Impeachment News
